Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Enterocin LD3 (natural AMPs; bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BWQ, unclassified)

Literature Information.Literature: Warning: only the N-terminal sequence is provided.Activity: Active against M. luteus MTCC106, S. aureus, E. cloaceae NRRL B14298, E. faecium NRRL B2354, L. acidophilus, P. fluorescens, P. aeruginosa, S. typhi, S. flexneri, L. monocytogenes, E. coli O157:H7, E. coli (urogenic, a clinical isolate) and Vibrio sp. based on growth inhibition zone assays (8-14 mm). It is of potential use in food preservation.
Literature Information.Author: Gupta A, Tiwari SK, Netrebov V, Chikindas ML.2016
Literature Information.Title: Biochemical Properties and Mechanism of Action of Enterocin LD3 Purified from Enterococcus hirae LD3.
